body.p: Match the phases of the cardiac cycle with their descriptions.

response.feedback: Correct. Systole is the time associated with active contraction.
Incorrect. Although this is part of systole, systole occurs both before and after these events as well.
Incorrect. This is the opposite of systole.
Incorrect. Although this is part of systole, this would not represent all of systole.
Incorrect. This is part of diastole.

part.hint: Systole is associated with the high point of arterial pressure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. During most of this time at least one valve will be open.
Correct. The volume stays the same when all valves are closed.
Incorrect. Contraction indicates the opposite of relaxation.
Incorrect. When the valves are open, volume is changing.
Incorrect. This occurs during the relaxation phase, not the contraction phase.

part.hint: Consider the state of the valves when ventricular volume is staying constant.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the opposite of diastole.
Incorrect. This is part of systole.
Correct. This is the definition of diastole.
Incorrect. This phase is part of systole.
Incorrect. Although this is part of diastole, diastole continues after this time as well.

part.hint: Diastole is associated with the low point of arterial pressure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although this occurs during systole, systole starts before ejection.
Incorrect. Ejection cannot occur when the valves are closed.
Incorrect. Ejection does not occur when the heart is relaxed.
Correct. Ejection occurs when these valves are open.
Incorrect. Ejection does not occur when the valves are closed.

part.hint: Consider the state of the valves necessary for this to occur.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Relaxation does not occur during active contraction.
Incorrect. Although both valves are closed, the heart is contracting during this period..
Incorrect. Although this occurs during relaxation, it does not encompass the entire time of relaxation.
Incorrect, when the valves are open the volume changes.
Correct. The volume stays the same when the valves are closed.

part.hint: Consider the state of the valves when ventricular volume is staying constant.
